features: RECOMMENDED FORMULA: This formula includes lutein, zeaxanthin, zinc, copper, vitamin C, and vitamin E to exactly match the nutrient formula recommended by the AMD experts at the National Eye Institute based on the Age Related Eye Disease Study 2 to help reduce the risk of moderate to advanced AMD progression.
AREDS 2 SUPPLEMENT: PreserVision is the #1 doctor recommended eye vitamin brand and is based on 20 years of clinical studies conducted by the NEI & includes Lutein & Zeaxanthin.

EYE VITAMINS BY BAUSCH + LOMB: Bausch + Lomb carries a full line of ocular supplements with vitamins, minerals & nutrients that include Lutein & Zeaxanthin that promote eye health, including PreserVision.
BAUSCH + LOMB EYE CARE EXPERTS: Since 1853, Bausch + Lomb has continued to focus on innovation and quality in eye care products, from contact lenses to lubricant eye drops.
MOST STUDIED BRAND: PreserVision is the most studied eye vitamin brand (based on the AREDS and AREDS2 clinical studies).
body.description: "PreserVision®AREDS 2 Formula Eye Vitamin and Mineral Supplement, from the eye care experts at Bausch + Lomb, contains the exact levels of six nutrients recommended by the National Eye Institute to help reduce the risk of progression in people with moderate to advanced Age-related Macular Degeneration (AMD)*. The 6 nutrients found in these eye health vitamins include lutein, zeaxanthin, vitamin E, vitamin C, zinc, and copper. Preservision is the most studied eye vitamin brand (based on the AREDS and AREDS2 clinical studies). PreserVision®AREDS 2 Formula Eye Vitamin and Mineral Supplement soft gels are eye supplements that build on the original, clinically proven PreserVision AREDS formula, with lutein and zeaxanthin replacing beta-carotene based on the National Eye Institute's Age-Related Eye Disease Study 2 (AREDS2). Ask your doctor if PreserVision AREDS2 Formula is right for you." •Soft Gels with 6 Essential Nutrients Recommended by the National Eye Institute •AREDS 2 Formula with Lutein and Zeaxanthin Replacing Beta-Carotene •#1 Doctor Recommended Brand1 •2 Soft Gels Per Day 1Data on File for #1 Doctor Recommended Brand, Bausch + Lomb.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Highly recommended by my eye doctor
reviews.reviewText: These are the best eye vitamins available. Extensive research done and they work. Easy to swallow and well worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 20, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Filled with Healthy Ingredients
reviews.reviewText: My ophthalmologist put me on eye vitamins to keep glaucoma in check. I asked if there was anything else covered by health insurance. He said, no. I have been taking them once a day for over a year. Whenever I go back for an eye check, he says, "Congratulations." The taste is no problem. They are small and easy to swallow. At first, I expected to see better. These keep my eyes from getting worse. I need my eyes so I am taking good care of them.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Eye Doctor Recommended
reviews.reviewText: My Ophthalmologist's office suggested taking PreserVision AREDS 2 vitamins. They even gave me a free sample pack to try. According to the packaging this eye vitamin formula is "based on 20 years of clinical studies." My hope in taking these vitamins is to prevent or slow down AMD (Age Related Macular Degeneration) and possibly Glaucoma. We all get older and our eyesight is precious. The product I bought on Amazon contained a bottle of 120 brown Mini Soft Gels. All the Gels in the bottle were in good condition (not stuck together, and they had no odor). Apparently, they were fresh because there was a long expiration date (21 months away). I've been taking these vitamins for 4 months now, and find this Mini Soft Gel formulation easy to swallow and I have not observed any side effects.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars My eye Dr recommends these vitamins.
reviews.reviewText: These pills are easy to swallow and they may help protect my eyesight. I take them morning and evening, as prescribed by my doctor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars This product is excellent for the aging eyes
reviews.reviewText: I am taking Preservision per my doctor’s recommendation. I have found that it helps with maintaining liquidity in the eyes and does not allow vision to decrease with age. I don’t have to get new glasses as frequently and I feel less discomfort as a whole.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy to obtain
reviews.reviewText: I like getting these pills from Amazon. I have them set up to come to me automatically which is very handy. Also I get a good quantity for a good price. Since I have to take 2 a day for my eyes ordering from Amazon is perfect for me.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars capsules all stuck together.
reviews.reviewText: When I opened the bottle of capsules they were all stuck together in one massive ball . The inner part of the bottle was stained orange, obviously moisture had entered the bottle. The whole mess was unusable. Obviously the enclosed packet meant to keep them dry did not work. Now I have to work to get a refund, and this is a very expensive medication.
Advised by my eye surgeon for general eye health .Had a check recently & he said hes very pleased with my eyes & no deterioration. His words were-"keep up with the AReds ".
Very prompt and hassle free delivery
